column2: ARIZONA DMV DRIVING TEST
column4: Arizona
column6: AZ

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: Yield
column6: A No Passing Zone

column2: 2. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 3. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column6: Move to the left

column2: 4. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: turn off the ignition.
column8: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 5. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: brake suddenly.
column6: activate your stop lights.
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 6. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 7. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: if you have the green light.
column6: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 8. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: can not turn left.
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 9. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Replacing worn wiper blades.

column2: 10. When the road is slippery you should:
column4: check your brakes.
column6: decrease the following distance.

column2: 11. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never depend on
column6: Always rely on

column2: 12. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Drivers who are fatigued.

column2: 13. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 14. Drivers should maintain a distance of at least ______ behind a fire department vehicle responding to an emergency.
column4: 300 feet
column6: 500 feet

column2: 15. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: reduce the minimum following distance.
column6: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 16. You must notify MVD of an address change within:
column4: 21 days.
column6: 10 days.

column2: 17. If you encounter a severe dust storm while driving you must, you should:
column4: maintain your speed and don’t change lanes.
column6: slow down and pull off the road.

column2: 18. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 19. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 20. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Yield sign ahead
column6: Warning, crossroad ahead

column2: 22. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: red; red
column6: yellow; black

column2: 23. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 24. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: help create a safe driving environment.
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 25. If you encounter a dust storm while driving, you should:
column4: wait until poor visibility makes it difficult to pull off the road, then cautiously drive through the storm.
column6: reduce your speed, drive completely off the road, turn on your lights and stay in the vehicle until the storm passes.
column8: reduce your speed, drive completely off the road, turn off your lights, take your foot off the brake, and stay in the vehicle with your seat belts buckled.

column2: 26. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way traffic ahead
column6: Four-lane traffic ahead

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Slippery when wet
column6: Road curves ahead

column2: 29. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 30. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
